episode_title: 124 - The One Where Rachel Finds Out

content.description: Central Perk, the whole gang is there, Ross is showing pictures of his new baby boy, Ben, to the group.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And here’s little Ben nodding off…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Awww, look at Aunt Monica’s little boy!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, look, he’s got Ross’s haircut!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, let me see! (grabs picture) Oh, God, is he just the sweetest thing? You must just want to kiss him all over!
(Ross is practically drooling over Rachel at this point.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That would be nice.
(Chandler, annoyed with Ross’s fawning, makes a ‘pfft’ noise.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pardon?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nothing, just a little extra air in my mouth. Pffft. Pffffffft. (walks over to where Joey is seated)
(Joey is looking at his check.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Chan, can you help me out here? I promise I’ll pay you back.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, yeah, right, OK… inlcuding the waffles last week, you now owe me… 17 jillion dollars.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I will, really. I’ll pay you back this time.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: … And where’s this money coming from? (gives money to Joey)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well… I’m helping out down at the N.Y.U. Med School with some… research.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What kind of research?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, just, y’know… science.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Science. Yeah, I think I’ve heard of that. (everyone’s interest is piqued, they all look over)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: … It’s a fertility study.
(Rachel laughs.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, Joey, please tell me you’re only donating your time .

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alright, come on you guys, it’s not that big a deal. Really… I mean, I just go down there every other day and… make my contribution to the project. Hey, hey, but at the end of two weeks, I get seven hundred dollars.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow, ooh, you’re gonna be making money hand over fist!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Phoebe are preparing for a barbecue for Rachel’s birthday.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: OK, we got the cole slaw, we got the buns…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We’ve got the ground-up flesh of formerly cute cows and turkeys, ew… (hands meat to Monica)
(Chandler and Joey enter with charcoal.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Men are here.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We make fire. Cook meat.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Then put out fire by peeing, no get invited back.

content.speaker: Monica and Phoebe
content.text: Ewww!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh Joey, Melanie called, said she’s gonna be late.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, OK.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So how are things going with you two? Is she becoming your (provocatively) special someone?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know, she’s, uh… she’s pretty great.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah? What does she think of your little science project?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What, you think I’m gonna tell a girl I like that I’m also seeing a cup?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Man’s got a point.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, the tough thing is, she really wants to have sex with me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Crazy bitch.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, well, I still got a week left to go in the program, and according to the rules, if I want to get the money I’m not allowed to conduct any… ersonal experiments, if you know what I mean.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey… we always know what you mean.
[Time lapse. Chandler and Joey are making the fire, Monica and Phoebe are inside. Ross enters, carrying luggage.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey. (Phoebe sees his bags)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How long did you think this barbecue was gonna last?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m going to China.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Jeez, you say one thing, and…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re going to China?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, i-it’s for the museum. Someone found a bone, we want the bone, but they don’t want us to have the bone, so I’m going over there to try to persuade them to give us the bo—it’s—it’s a whole big bone thing. Anyway, I’m gonna be gone for like, uh… like a week, so, uh, if you wanna reach me, y-you can’t. So here’s my itinerary (hands a sheet of paper to Monica). Um… here’s a picture of me… (hands it to Monica)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, let me see! (takes the picture)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: : Could you take it to Carol’s every now and then, and show it to Ben, just so he doesn’t forget me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah.
(Phoebe puts the picture of Ross up to her face.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi, Ben. I’m your father. I am… the head. Aaaaaahhhh… (puts picture down, sees Ross staring at her) Alright, this barbecue is gonna be very fun.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, is Rachel here? Um, I wanted to wish her a happy birthday before I left.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh no, she’s out having drinks with Carl.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh. (pause) Hey, who’s Carl?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know, that guy she met at the coffeehouse.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, well, see, there’s this guy she met at the…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: At the coffeehouse, right.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So you do know who he is! (laughs, Ross stares at her) Sorry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK, I’m gonna go say goodbye to the guys.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, hey, y’know what? Tell them that bone story.
(Ross goes outisde on the balcony.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …I have to go to China.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The country?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No no, this big pile of dishes in my mom’s breakfront. Do you guys know who Carl is?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, let’s see… Alvin… Simon… Theodore… no.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, Rachel’s having drinks with him tonight.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh no! How can she do that when she’s never shown any interest in you?!?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Forget about her.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He’s right, man. Please. Move on. Go to China. Eat Chinese food.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Course there, they just call it food.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah… I guess. I don’t—I don’t know. Alright, just… just give her this for me, OK? (gives Chandler a gift for Rachel)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Listen, buddy, we’re just looking out for you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We want you to be happy. And I may only have a couple beers in me, but… I love you, man. (Joey gives Ross a hug)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m still on my first. I just think you’re nice.
[Time lapse. Melanie, Joey’s girlfriend, is there with Joey, Chandler, Monica, Phoebe, and Rachel. Ross is gone.]

content.speaker: Melanie
content.text: Anyway, that’s when me and my friends started this whole fruit basket business. We call ourselves ‘The Three Basketeers.’

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Like the three musketeers, only with fruit.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ooooh. (looks dumbfounded at Joey’s stupidity)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: OK, how does everybody like their burgers?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, no, no, no. Presents first. Food later. (walks into living room)
(Everyone follows Rachel to the living room. Monica pulls Joey aside.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, hold on there, tiger. How’s it going? How you holding up?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, not so good. She definitely thinks tonight is the night we’re gonna… complete the transaction, if you know what I…
(Monica rolls her eyes.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Then you do. Heh, heh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, uh, have you ever thought about being there for her ?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What do you mean?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know, just be there for her .
(Long pause… Joey looks confused.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Not following you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Think about it.
(They both walk over to where Rachel is opening her gifts. Rachel sees her first gift is a fruit basket.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK, I’m guessing this is from…
(Melanie smiles.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, thank you, Melanie.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OK, this one right here is from me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK… ah, it’s light… (shakes it)…it rattles… it’s… (opens it) Travel Scrabble ! Oooohhh, thank you! (she gives it back to him)
(Chandler looks dejected. Rachel picks up another gift.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: This one’s from Joey… feels like a book. Thinks it’s a book… feels like a book. And…(opens it)…it’s a book!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, it’s Dr. Seuss!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: : That book got me through some tough times.

content.speaker: Melanie
content.text: There is a little child inside this man!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, the doctors say if they remove it, he’ll die.
(Rachel picks up the next gift.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Who’s this from?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, that’s Ross’s.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh… (opens it)… (sees it is a pin) Oh my God. He remembered.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Remembered what?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It was like months ago. We were walking by this antique store, and I saw this pin in the window, and I told him it was just like one my grandmother had when I was a little girl. Oh! I can’t believe he remembered!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, sure, but can you play it on a plane? (pats his Travel Scrabble game)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, it’s so pretty. This must have cost him a fortune.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe he did this.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Come on, Ross? Remember back in college, when he fell in love with Carol and bought her that ridiculously expensive crystal duck?
(Everyone looks at him. He realizes he just spilled the beans about Ross’s crush on Rachel. You can hear this entire classic scene by clicking here.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What did you just say?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: ahem… um… Crystal duck.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, no, no… the, um, the… ‘love’ part?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: F-hah… flennin…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh… my God.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, no-no-no-no-no…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s good, just keep rubbing your head. That’ll turn back time.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean, this is unbelievable.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know. This is really, really huge.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No it’s not. It’s small. It’s tiny. It’s petite. It’s wee.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nuh-uh. I don’t think any of our lives are ever gonna be the same ever again.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OK, is there a mute button on this woman?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I think this is so great! I mean, you and Ross! D-did you have any idea?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! None! I mean, my first night in the city, he mentioned something about asking me out, but nothing ever happened, so I just… (to Joey): W-well, what else did he say? I mean, does he, like, want to go out with me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, given that he’s desperately in love with you, he probably wouldn’t mind getting a cup of coffee or something.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross? All this time? Well, I’ve got to talk to him. (gets up to leave)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: H-He’s in China!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The country.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, no, wait. (checks Ross’s itinerary) His flight doesn’t leave for another forty-five more minutes.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What about the time difference?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: From here to the airport?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes! (Rachel walks towards door) You’re never gonna make it!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel, what’re you gonna say to him?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I-I-I don’t know.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well then maybe you shouldn’t go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He’s right, cause if you’re just gonna, like, break his heart, that’s the kind of thing that can wait.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, but if it’s good news, you should tell him now.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know. Maybe I’ll know when I see him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Here, look, alright, does this help?
(Phoebe gets up, holds the picture of Ross up to her face.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Noooo… look, all I know is that I cannot wait a week until I see him. I mean, this is just too big. Y’know, I just, I’ve just gotta talk to him. I… I gotta… OK, I’ll see you later. (opens door)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Rachel, I love you! Deal with me first! (she leaves)

content.description: Airport, Ross has headphones on, and is listening to a ‘How To Speak Chinese’ tape. Occasionally, he makes an outburst in Chinese in accordance with the tape. He is getting on the jetway. The flight attendant is there.

content.speaker: Flight Attendant
content.text: Alright!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ni-chou chi-ma! (walks onto jetway)
(Rachel runs into the airport, trying to catch Ross, moving people out of the way.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross! Excuse me, pardon me, excuse me…
(Rachel gets up to the jetway.)

content.speaker: Flight Attendant
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Flight Attendant
content.text: May I see your boarding pass?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, no, no, I don’t have one. I just need to talk to my friend.

content.speaker: Flight Attendant
content.text: Oh, oooh. I’m sorry. You are not allowed on the jetway unless you have a boarding pass.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I know, but I—he just went on. He’s right there, he’s got the blue jacket on, I… can I j-just…

content.speaker: Flight Attendant
content.text: No no no! Federal regulations!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK, alright, OK, um… then could you please, uh… just give him a message for me? Please? This is very important.

content.speaker: Flight Attendant
content.text: Alright. What’s the message?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh… I don’t know.
[Cut to the Jetway, the flight attendant enters, walks past Ross, and approaches an older man with his wife who is also wearing a blue jacket.]

content.speaker: Flight Attendant
content.text: Sir? Sir? Excuse me, sir? Uh… I have a message for you.

content.speaker: Man
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Flight Attendant
content.text: It’s from Rachel. She said that she loved the present, and she will see you when you get back.

content.speaker: Man
content.text: : Toby… Oh, for God’s sake, I don’t know what she’s talking about! There’s no Rachel! Don’t give me that deep freeze.

content.description: Joey’s Bedroom, he and Melanie are in bed together.

content.speaker: Melanie
content.text: Mmmmmm… Oh, Joey, Joey, Joey… I think I blacked out there for a minute!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Heh, heh. It was nothin’.

content.speaker: Melanie
content.text: Well, now we’ve gotta find something fun for you! (she starts kissing his chest)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhhh.. y’know what? Forget about me. Let’s, uh… let’s give you another turn.

content.speaker: Melanie
content.text: M-Me again?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure! Why not?

content.speaker: Melanie
content.text: Boy, somebody’s gonna get a big fruit basket tomorrow.
(Joey starts to kiss her.)

content.speaker: Melanie
content.text: Oooh, I gotta tell you… you are nothing like I thought you would be.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How do you mean?

content.speaker: Melanie
content.text: I don’t know, I-I guess I just had you pegged as one of those guys who’re always ’me, me, me.’ But you… you’re a giver. You’re like the most generous man I ever met. I mean… you’re practically a woman.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica, Phoebe, and Rachel are there. Monica is holding the wrapping paper from one of Rachel’s gifts.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh, so, uh, Rach, uh… do you wanna save this wrapping paper, I mean, it’s only a little bit torn… so are you gonna go for it with Ross or should I just throw it out?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know. I don’t know… I thought about it all the way there, and I thought about it all the way back… and, uh, oh, you guys, y’know, it’s Ross . Y’know what I mean? I mean, it’s Ross .

content.speaker: Monica and Phoebe
content.text: Sure.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know, I mean, this is just my initial gut feeling… but I’m thinking… oh, I’m thinking it’d be really great.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, me too! Oh! Oh, we’d be like friends-in-law! Y’know what the best part is? The best part is that you already know everything about him! I mean, it’s like starting on the fifteenth date!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but, y’know, it’s… it would be like starting on the fifteenth date.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Another good point.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I mean, I mean, when you’re at the fifteenth date, y’know, you’re already in a very relationshippy place. Y’know, it’s… you’re committed.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Huh?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I mean, then what happens if it doesn’t work out?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why isn’t it working out?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know… sometimes it doesn’t.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is he not cute enough for you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Does he not make enough money?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I’m just…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Maybe there’s someone else.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wha…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is there? Is there someone else?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! There is.. there is noone else!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Then why the hell are you dumping my brother?!?

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is eating breakfast, Joey quietly opens his bedroom door.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, big…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Shhhh!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …spender.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She’s still asleep.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So how’d it go?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, it was amazing. You know how you always think you’re great in bed?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The fact that you’d even ask that question shows how little you know me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, it’s like, last night, I couldn’t do the thing that usually makes me great. So I had to do all this other stuff. And the response I got… man, oh man, it was like a ticker tape parade!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, I know, as it happens my room is very very close to the parade route.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It was amazing! And not just for her… uh-uh. For me, too. It’s like, all of a sudden, I’m blind. But all my other senses are heightened, y’know? It’s like… I was able to appreciate it on another level.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I didn’t know you had another level.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know! Neither did I!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, one week later. Monica is seated, Rachel comes out of her bedroom.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, great skirt! Birthday present?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, from who?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: From you. I exchanged the blouse you got me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, it’s the thought. Hey, doesn’t Ross’s flight get in in a couple hours? At gate 27-B?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, yeah. Uh, Monica, y’know, honey, I’ve been thinking about it and I’ve decided this—this whole Ross thing, it’s just not a good idea.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, why?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Because, I feel like I wouldn’t just be going out with him. I would be going out with all of you. Oh, and there would just be all this pressure, and I don’t wanna…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, no, no, no, no, no pressure, no pressure!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, nothing has even happened yet, and you’re already so…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I am not ’so’! OK, I was a teensy bit weird at first, but… I’ll be good. I promise.
(Door buzzer goes off. Rachel answers it.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Who is it?

content.speaker: Intercom
content.text: It’s me, Carl.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: C’mon up.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Behind my brother’s back? (Rachel glares at her) … is exactly the kind of crazy thing you won’t be hearing from me.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is seated, and the apartment is filled with baskets of fruit. Joey enters, check in hand.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Seven hundred bucks!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright, you did it! Do we have any fruit?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Man, hell of a two weeks, huh? Y’know what, though? I really feel like I learned something.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really? So, you’re gonna stick with this ‘it’s all for her’ thing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What, are you crazy? When a blind man gets his sight back, does he walk around like this? (Joey closes his eyes and walks around with arms spread.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s Balcony, Rachel is having drinks with her date, Carl.

content.speaker: Carl
content.text: I’m just sayin’, if I see one more picture of Ed Begley, Jr. in that stupid electric car, I’m gonna shoot myself! I mean, don’t get me wrong… I’m not against environmental issues per se … it’s just that guy!
(Rachel looks bored. At this point, Ross—a figment of Rachel’s imagination— shows up on the balcony and starts talking to her.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I can’t believe you’d rather go out with him than me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Would you excuse me, please? I’m trying to have a date here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fine, just stop thinking about me.
(She tries, and Ross disappears momentarily. He reappears, standing closer to her.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Can’t do it, can you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So I’m thinking about you. So what?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t get it. What do you see in this guy, anyway?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well… he happens to be a very nice… guy…

content.speaker: Carl
content.text: I mean, come on, buddy, get a real car !

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rachel, come on. Give us a chance.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, it’s too hard.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, no… why, because it might get weird for everyone else? Who cares about them. This is about us. Look, I-I’ve been in love with you since, like, the ninth grade.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, you’re like my best friend.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: If we broke up, and I lost you…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa. What makes you think we’re gonna break up?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, have you been involved with someone where you haven’t broken up?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. But… it only has to happen once . Look, you and I both know we are perfect for each other, right? I mean… so, the only question is… are you attracted to me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know… I mean, I’ve never looked at you that way before.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, start looking.
(They kiss. Ross walks away, and then fades out.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow.

content.speaker: Carl
content.text: Exactly! And you just know I’m gonna be the guy caught behind this hammerhead in traffic!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right! You’re right!

content.speaker: Carl
content.text: Heh… y’know?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You know what?

content.speaker: Carl
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I forgot… I am supposed to pick up a friend at the airport. I am so sorry! I’m so… if you want to stay, and finish your drinks, please do… (gives him her drink) I mean—I’m sorry. I-I-I gotta go. I’m sorry.
(Rachel leaves.)

content.speaker: Carl
content.text: But…

content.description: [Scene: Airport. Madonna’s Take A Bow plays in the background as Rachel waits at the gate with flowers.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Excuse me, pardon me, excuse me, excuse me, sorry. Hi.
[Cut to the jetway, the old man who the flight attendant delivered Rachel’s message to gets off the plane, his wife still upset with him.]

content.speaker: Man
content.text: For God’s sake, will you let it go? There’s no Rachel!
(A Chinese woman getting off the plane drops one of her bags. Ross gets off next.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, hey, hey, I got that.
(Ross picks up the bag… then he and the woman kiss.)

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Oh, thanks, sweetie.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No problem. I cannot wait for you to meet my friends.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: You don’t think they’ll judge and ridicule me?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, they will. I just… uh…

content.speaker: Ross and Julie
content.text: Can’t wait.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on, they’re gonna love you.
[Cut to a close-up of Rachel, eagerly awaiting Ross’s arrival… not knowing he is getting off the plane with another woman.]
